title: Fix video playback tests in headless Playwright
close_reason: Research complete. Issue is NOT codec-related. Real blocker is app bug swing-o6o (play button not working). Tests updated with accurate skip reasons.

comments.author: developer
comments.text:
## Problem
6 tests in user-journey.spec.ts are skipped because video playback doesnt work in headless Chromium.

## Root Cause  
Headless Chromium lacks proprietary codec support (H.264/AAC) due to licensing.

## Solution
Use branded Chrome: channel: chrome in playwright.config.ts

## Sources
- https://github.com/microsoft/playwright/issues/37979
- https://playwright.dev/docs/browsers

comments.author: developer
comments.text:
## Research Conclusion

After researching all three alternatives:

1. **FFmpeg** - NOT a solution (only for test recording, not playback)
2. **Firefox/WebKit** - NOT recommended (unreliable headless codec support)
3. **channel: chrome** - RECOMMENDED (full codec support, simple change)

## Implementation
Add channel: chrome to playwright.config.ts and run npx playwright install chrome in CI.

## Trade-offs
- 200MB download vs 150MB
- 10-15% slower than headless shell
- Full codec support for video playback

comments.author: developer
comments.text:
## Update: WebM/VP9 works in headless Chromium!

Tested video playback in this container (Linux ARM64):
- Chrome branded: NOT available on ARM64
- WebM/VP9 in headless Chromium: WORKS

The tests were skipped when video was MP4/H.264. Since switching to WebM, playback works. The test.skip() annotations may be outdated.

Next step: Remove test.skip() from video playback tests and verify they pass.

comments.author: developer
comments.text:
## Final Status

Research complete. Key findings:

1. **WebM/VP9 IS supported** in headless Chromium - codec is NOT the issue
2. **Chrome branded not available** on Linux ARM64 (this container)
3. **Real issue identified**: App bug where play button click doesn't start playback (linked to swing-o6o)

Tests updated with accurate skip reasons referencing swing-o6o. 14 tests pass, 4 skipped due to app bug.

title: Redraw skeleton on manual video seek
description:
## Problem
When user seeks/scrubs to a different position in the video while paused, the skeleton overlay does not redraw for that frame. The canvas remains blank until playback resumes.

## E2E Test Added
- `e2e-tests/user-journey.spec.ts` - "Skeleton Redraw on Seek" test section
- Test confirms bug: `skeleton redraws when video is seeked manually` FAILS
- Canvas has no content after seek while paused

## Root Cause (to investigate)
The `VideoFrameAcquisition` only emits frames when video is playing:
```javascript
this.videoElement.paused ? NEVER : interval(frameInterval)...
```

Need to also emit a frame on the 'seeked' event when paused.

## Files to Fix
- `src/pipeline/VideoFrameAcquisition.ts` - add seeked event handler
- Possibly `src/hooks/useSwingAnalyzer.tsx` - ensure skeleton renders on seek
close_reason: E2E test added that confirms the bug. Test fails as expected - skeleton doesn't redraw on seek while paused. Bug fix is separate work.

title: Debug rep counter not updating with cached poses during playback
description:
## Problem
Rep counter doesn't update when video plays with CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer (streaming mode), even though skeleton overlay renders correctly.

## Context
When extraction starts, VideoSection.tsx calls reinitializeWithLiveCache() which creates a new pipeline using CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer instead of the ML-based PoseSkeletonTransformer. The skeleton overlay works (proving cached poses are being read), but rep count stays at 0.

## Key Files to Investigate
- `src/hooks/useSwingAnalyzer.tsx` lines 145-170 - pipeline subscription setup, setRepCount callback
- `src/pipeline/Pipeline.ts` - full pipeline flow: skeleton → form → rep
- `src/pipeline/CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer.ts` - transforms frames to skeletons using cached data
- `src/pipeline/SwingFormProcessor.ts` - detects swing positions (Top, Connect, Bottom, Release)
- `src/pipeline/SwingRepProcessor.ts` - counts reps based on position sequence
- `src/components/VideoSection.tsx` lines 52-60 - reinitializeWithLiveCache trigger

## Pipeline Flow
1. VideoFrameAcquisition emits FrameEvent (on video play/pause)
2. CachedPoseSkeletonTransformer looks up cached pose → emits SkeletonEvent
3. SwingFormProcessor detects position → emits FormEvent/checkpoint
4. SwingRepProcessor counts reps → emits RepEvent
5. Pipeline.resultSubject pushes to useSwingAnalyzer which calls setRepCount

## Debug Steps
1. Add console.logs in Pipeline.ts to verify skeleton events emit (line 72-75)
2. Check if formProcessor.processFrame receives skeletons (line 84-86)
3. Check if repProcessor.updateRepCount receives checkpoints (line 97-100)
4. Verify setRepCount callback is being called (useSwingAnalyzer.tsx line 150)

## Hypothesis
The issue might be:
- Form processor not detecting positions from cached skeletons
- Pipeline subscriptions not set up correctly after reinitialize
- Skeleton events emitting but form processor filtering them out
close_reason: Fixed by adding tolerance to LivePoseCache.getFrame() - during streaming mode, only use frames within 100ms of requested time. This prevents stale poses from being reused, allowing proper cycle detection and rep counting.

title: E2E test cache lookup not finding seeded pose data
description: The 'skeleton redraws on seek' E2E test seeds pose data to IndexedDB but the app doesn't find it. Extraction starts instead of using cached poses. Hash was updated to match swing-sample.webm but lookup still fails. Need to investigate timing or DB access in E2E context.
